snippet: The United Nations reported that 11,000 Syrians fled on Friday, the vast majority of them clambering for safety over the Turkish border.
abstract: United Nations reports that 11,000 Syrians fled to neighboring countries in one day, vast majority clambering for safety over Turkish border, in one of the largest single-day torrents of refugees since the Syrian conflict began.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Neil MacFarquhar from Doha, Qatar. Reporting was contributed by Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; Sebnem Arsu from Hatay, Turkey; Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon; and Christine Hauser from New York.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations reported that 11,000 Syrians fled on Friday, the vast majority of them clambering for safety over the Turkish border.

headline.main: In One Day, 11,000 Flee Syria as War and Hardship Worsen
headline.print_headline: In One Day, 11,000 Flee Syria as Violence and Hardship Worsen, Alarming Turkey
